eu.smartdatalake.simsearch.pivoting.rtree

Class MultiMetricSimilaritySearch

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.smartdatalake.simsearch.pivoting.rtree.MultiMetricSimilaritySearch

  • public class MultiMetricSimilaritySearch
extends Object
    Implements the method for top-k similarity search against the an index holding (embedded) multi-dimensional points using various distances. Also offers an auxiliary method for estimating scale factors on distances per attribute (distance).

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultiMetricSimilaritySearch

        public MultiMetricSimilaritySearch(Map<String,Map<?,?>> datasets,
                                   String[] attrIdentifiers,
                                   MetricReferences r,
                                   double[] w,
                                   double[] s,
                                   Logger log)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        datasets - Dictionary of input datasets used in creating the underlying index.
        attrIdentifiers - Attribute identifiers per distance metric, each corresponding to the input datasets.
        r - Representation of distances and number of reference (pivot) values per attribute.
        w - Array of weights per attribute to be applied in estimating overall distances.
        s - Array of scale factors per attribute to be applied in estimating overall distances.
        log - Handle to the log file for notifications and execution statistics.

    • Method Detail

      • search

        public <T,S extends Geometry,D> Iterable<NearestEntry<T,S,Double>> search(Node<T,S> node,
                                                                          Point q,
                                                                          Map<String,Point> qOrig,
                                                                          int k)
        Recursively examining whether to continue searching the subtree of a node; tree traversal should start from the root.
        Parameters:
        node - Node of the tree currently searched during tree traversal.
        q - The multi-dimensional representation of the query point; Actually, the MBR of the query location is used as focus in the search.
        qOrig - The original query values per attribute.
        k - The number k of entities to fetch as most similar to the query.
        Returns:
        A collection of the k entities held in the tree that are most similar to the query.

      • getScaleFactor

        public <T,S extends Geometry,D> double getScaleFactor(Node<T,S> node,
                                                      Point q,
                                                      int k)
        Auxiliary method that estimates a factor to be used for scaling distances on a particular attribute (distance). Involves a k-NN query that involves only values regarding a single attribute (distance); weights for the rest are set to 0.
        Parameters:
        node - Node of the tree currently searched during tree traversal.
        q - The multi-dimensional representation of the query point; Actually, the MBR of the query location is used as focus in the search.
        k - The number k of entities to keep as most similar to query q (on a single attribute only).
        Returns:
        The distance of the k-th most similar entity from query q; if this distance is 0, then the first non-zero distance is returned.

      • minDistMBR

        private double minDistMBR(Point q,
                          Rectangle r)
        Weighted distance bound between a multi-dimensional query point from a multi-dimensional rectangle.
        Parameters:
        q - M-dimensional query point (already embedded according to pivots).
        r - R-dimensional MBR indexed in the tree structure.
        Returns:
        Weighted distance bound involved in similarity search.

      • minDistMBR

        private double minDistMBR(double[] q,
                          Rectangle r)
        Weighted distance bound between a multi-dimensional query point from a multi-dimensional rectangle.
        Parameters:
        q - Coordinate vector of an M-dimensional query point (already embedded according to pivots).
        r - R-dimensional MBR indexed in the tree structure.
        Returns:
        Weighted distance bound involved in similarity search.

      • minDistPoint

        private double minDistPoint(Point q,
                            Point v)
        Weighted distance bound between a multi-dimensional query point from a multi-dimensional reference object.
        Parameters:
        q - M-dimensional query point (already embedded according to pivots).
        v - R-dimensional embedded object (R may be larger than M).
        Returns:
        Weighted distance bound involved in similarity search.

      • minDistPoint

        private double minDistPoint(double[] q,
                            double[] v)
        Weighted distance bound between a multi-dimensional query point from a multi-dimensional embedded object.
        Parameters:
        q - Coordinate vector of an R-dimensional query point (already embedded according to pivots).
        v - R-dimensional vector holding the embedding of an indexed object (R may be grater than M).
        Returns:
        Weighted distance bound involved in similarity search.

      • exactDistance

        private double exactDistance(Object oid,
                             Map<String,Point> qPoint)
        Compute the exact distance between the query and the entity with the given identifier. FIXME: Should we apply exponential decay on each metric prior of weighing them?
        Parameters:
        oid - Unique identifier of an entity embedded and indexed in the tree.
        qPoint - Original (NOT embedded) attribute values of the query.
        Returns:
        The exact weighted and scaled distance to be reported.

      • rescale

        private double rescale(double d,
                       int m)
        Rescale (i.e., normalize) the given distance value with the scale factor specified for this attribute (metric).
        Parameters:
        d - The original distance value computed using the distance metric.
        m - The m-th distance metric utilized in computations, i.e., for the m-th attribute.
        Returns:
        The scale distance value.
